definition[0]: a formal agreement between two groups, countries, or people, especially to help each other or to stop fighting
example[1]: The two countries signed a non-aggression pact.
example[2]: a defence pact with the USA
example[3]: a peace pact between the rebels and the government
definition[1]: a formal agreement between two countries, companies, groups of people etc, promising to do something for each other or help each other in some way
example[4]: Workers at the factory ratified a three-year pact (=made it official) that boosts their pay.
example[5]: The National Institute of Health signed a pact with a Japanese drug company to develop and test a new anti-AIDS drug.
example[6]: Mexico is in its fourth month of negotiations on a free-trade pact with the US and Canada.
